entry.title: Combined summary - Just FYI
entry.summary: The email conversation on the bitcoin-dev mailing list advises that any alteration to a public key must be republished, whereas a private key should never be published. The sender, Frank Flores requests that if someone signs their public emails, they should publish their public key on a major key server or somewhere that can be crawled by Google. He provides instructions on how to do this on stock gnupg and includes a disclaimer that OpenPGP is not perfect.Venzen asks for clarification on publishing keys after they have been signed. He addresses Peter Todd, who previously gave gpg advice about publishing keys. Venzen's questions are not specific to the GNU Privacy Guard (GnuPG), but he notes that his request would benefit those on the GnuPG support list. The message includes a PGP signature, indicating the authenticity of the message.The email exchange emphasizes that only the public key is required for verifying signed messages. It also contained a GnuPG command for sending a key to a keyserver. The conversation ends with a quote by Serj Tankian stating "MONEY IS OVER!" and highlights the tyranny of money.
